result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
(clerked by RW)
Defendant Stephen N Newman in court telephonically from Dodge Correctional Institution with attorney Frederick A Bechtold.  Rachel Kibbe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
THIS COVERS 15CM329 & 15CM519
Parties agree to proceed with the hearing by telephone. State relates agreement. Victim impact statement filed. 
15CM329 - State moves to amend count 2 to 943.34(1)(a). Court grants amendment. State moves to dismiss and read in count 4 and 15CM519. Court orders count 4 and 15CM519 be dismissed and read-in. 
Defendant pleads guilty to amended count 2 in 15CM329. Court accepts the plea and finds the Defendant guilty.

Defendant Stephen N Newman in court with attorney Ryan O'Hara for today.  Defendant Stephen N Newman in custody.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. THIS COVERS 15CF575, 15CM329 AND 15CM519.
